nodes.html: The Sickle Cell Disease Ontology (SCDO) project is a collaboration between H3ABioNet (Pan African Bioinformatics Network) and SPAN (Sickle Cell Disease Pan African Network).

any.message: Element has sufficient color contrast of 13.19
Element has sufficient color contrast of 12.63

nodes.html: The purpose of the SCDO is to:

any.message: Element has sufficient color contrast of 12.63

nodes.html: • establish community standardized SCD terms and descriptions.

any.message: Element has sufficient color contrast of 12.63

nodes.html: • establish canonical and hierarchical representation of knowledge on SCD.

any.message: Element has sufficient color contrast of 12.63

nodes.html: • link to other ontologies and bodies of work such as DO, PhenX MeSH, ICD, NCI’s thesaurus, SNOMED and OMIM.

any.message: Element has sufficient color contrast of 12.63

nodes.html: Once complete, we anticipate that the ontology will:

any.message: Element has sufficient color contrast of 12.63

nodes.html: • be the most comprehensive collection of knowledge in the SCD.

any.message: Element has sufficient color contrast of 12.63

nodes.html: • facilitate exploration of new scientific questions and ideas.

any.message: Element has sufficient color contrast of 12.63

nodes.html: • facilitate seamless data sharing and collaborations including meta-analysis within the SDC community.

any.message: Element has sufficient color contrast of 12.63

nodes.html: • support the building of databasing and clinical informatics in SCD.

any.message: Element has sufficient color contrast of 12.63

passes.description: Ensures the order of headings is semantically correct
passes.help: Heading levels should only increase by one

ancestry: html > body > div:nth-child(2) > header:nth-child(4) > div > h1:nth-child(2)
html > body > div:nth-child(2) > header:nth-child(4) > div > h2:nth-child(3)
html > body > div:nth-child(2) > div:nth-child(5) > div:nth-child(1) > main > article > header:nth-child(1) > div > h1
html > body > div:nth-child(2) > div:nth-child(5) > div:nth-child(1) > main > article > div:nth-child(2) > figure:nth-child(2) > div > iframe
html > body > div:nth-child(2) > div:nth-child(5) > div:nth-child(2) > aside > h2:nth-child(1)
html > body > div:nth-child(2) > div:nth-child(5) > div:nth-child(2) > aside > div:nth-child(2) > div:nth-child(11) > div > h2:nth-child(1)
